snippet: Two vast wildfires that burned up parts of Northern California, killing six people and forcing the evacuation of thousands of people, did nearly $2 billion in damage.
abstract: London-based insurer Aon Benfield reports Northern California wildfires in Lake, Calaveras and Amador Counties wrought nearly $2 billion in combined damage.
lead_paragraph: Two vast wildfires that burned up parts of Northern California, killing six people and forcing the evacuation of thousands of people, did nearly $2 billion in damage.

headline.print_headline: California: September Wildfires Caused $2 Billion in Damage, Insurer Says
headline.main: California: September Wildfires Caused $2 Billion in Damage, Insurer Says
